questions.question_text: When instructed by ATC to hold short of Runway pilot should stop:
options: With nose gear on hold line
So that no part of the A/c extends beyond hold line
So that the Fit Deck Area of A/c is even with the hold line

questions.question_text: The following aircraft will be given priority to land:
options: An aircraft with VVIP on board
An aircraft with critical shortage of fuel
A scheduled aircraft

questions.question_text: Apron is an area on aerodrome where following activities take place:
options: Loading/unloading of passengers, mail and cargo only.
Parking of aircraft only.
Loading/unloading of passengers, mail and cargo, fueling, parking or maintenance.

questions.question_text: For safety reasons, a person should remain away from a jet engine by at least:
Movement area of an aerodrome constitutes the following
options: Area including runways / taxiways excluding apron
Area excluding taxiways but including runways and apron
Area including runways/taxiways/aprons

questions.question_text: The maneuvering area of an airport is that area
options: Normally referred to as the ramp or apron.
Used for taxiing, taking off and landing.
Used when taxiing to and from the parking area.

questions.question_text: An Aircraft shall report "long final" when it is at from the approach end of the rwy
options: 8NMs
4NMs
1NMs
It must be located within a CTR.
It must have a control tower giving an ATC service.
It must have a control tower and be in a CTR.

questions.question_text: Aerodrome traffic is considered to be:
options: Aircraft on the movement area and flying in the vicinity.
Aircraft on the manoeuvring area and flying in the vicinity.
Aircraft on the movement area only.

questions.question_text: Aircraft shall not be held closer to a runway-in-use:
options: Than at a runway-holding position.
Than at runway edge.
Than at 40m from the runway edge.
